{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3695008,"name":"Brody Anderson","username":"flamekeeper","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/flamekeeper/{size}/267435_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-31T02:23:32.738Z","cooked":"

FRCodeBlocks

Blockly to Java for the 2026 FRC season

I’ve started work on a website that lets you build FRC robot code using drag and drop blocks, and then automatically generates Java code you can copy into WPILib projects or download.

The main goals are to make programming more accessible, and to make a simplified interface for prototyping.

What It Does:

  • Utilizes a drag-and-drop interface powered by Blockly
  • Generates Java code real time, allows for downloading and copy / pasting
  • Uses both basic Java and FRC specific blocks
  • Allows for high customization; including themes, data types, methods, file structures, and more
  • Let’s you save projects to pick up later

Who It’s For:

  • Rookie programmers learning Java + WPILib
  • Mentors/teachers introducing students to FRC coding
  • Developers who want to quickly churn out code for prototyping
  • Pretty much anyone who wants to teach or learn Java for FRC or otherwise

Current Status:

  • Some basic Java and FRC methods
  • Github pages site up (Switching to a standalone site soon)
  • Custom themes, tabs, data types, and methods
  • Downloading and copying
  • Block workspace saving

What’s Next:

  • Making a more robust FRC library
  • Making more and improving current project examples
  • Making an app version for people to download

Looking for Feedback (and assistance):

If you’re an FRC programmer, mentor, or curriculum developer, I’d love feedback:

  • What features would you want to see?
  • What are libraries you want included?
  • Are there any features you would like to see improved or changed?
  • What would make this more accessible for teachers and students alike?
  • What would features could make this more useful to a more advanced programmer?

I’ll keep updating this post as progress continues. Feel free to DM me or reply to this for any suggestions, contributions, or major bugs. Please use github issues for bugs you find so it can be kept track of.

Repo: GitHub - Flamekeeper700/FRCodeBlocks
Website: FRC Blockly Visual IDE

-Brody A, FRC6004 lead programmer

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-07-31T05:41:53.463Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":283,"readers_count":282,"score":61.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":504836,"topic_slug":"frcodeblocks-blockly-to-java-for-frc","display_username":"Muaz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66997,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1259 Driver and Lead Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/frcodeblocks-blockly-to-java-for-frc/504836/3","custom_user_title":"1259 Driver and Lead Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3695207,"name":"Dan Peled","username":"Dan1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dan1/{size}/268085_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-31T07:27:39.379Z","cooked":"

From my quick overview the following things I didn’t manage to do:

  • Set a motor variable (where’s the value I set it to? Not in the motors section?)
  • Same for encoders
  • Create a command class (where’s the command definition? Only found the functions to override but not the command decleration itself)

Problematic things that I did manage to do:

  • Set a variable to an invalid name
  • Generate invalid code as a command, it outputted the code from the command instead from into a class into the robot class
  • Both Constants.java & RobotContainer.java generated withot any class, but with invalid code I managed to generate into them

While this seems like an interesting project, it seems to have some major problems that need fixing before being actually usable

Currently you can only generate a few methods for a few FRC libraries so you can’t program a robot. However, adding new blocks is one of the first priorities right now, so within a few weeks you should be able to get pretty far in programming a robot, if not be able to do it completely

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-07-31T11:38:15.511Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":225,"readers_count":224,"score":45.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504836,"topic_slug":"frcodeblocks-blockly-to-java-for-frc","display_username":"Brody Anderson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":66997,"username":"mtareen","name":"Muaz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mtareen/{size}/268933_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74592,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/frcodeblocks-blockly-to-java-for-frc/504836/6","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3695231,"name":"Brody Anderson","username":"flamekeeper","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/flamekeeper/{size}/267435_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-31T11:44:41.885Z","cooked":"

Thank you for pointing those out. I plan on redoing the motor section to have each motor type be an individual category, and from there I will make blocks for the methods and constructors for each motor/encoder. Commands, Subsystems, Robot, Constants, and Robot Container currently have placeholder methods and base code, so I will replace those ASAP. As for the invalid variable names I’ll work out a way for the IDE to either 1: not allow you to type an invalid name, or 2: show an error explaining why what you typed is an invalid name.
Once again, thank you for the feedback

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-07-31T11:44:41.885Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":215,"readers_count":214,"score":53.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504836,"topic_slug":"frcodeblocks-blockly-to-java-for-frc","display_username":"Brody Anderson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":67107,"username":"Dan1","name":"Dan Peled","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dan1/{size}/268085_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74592,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/frcodeblocks-blockly-to-java-for-frc/504836/7","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3695267,"name":"Alon Vaisgur","username":"AlonVaisgur","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/alonvaisgur/{size}/220349_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-31T13:20:52.807Z","cooked":"

Appreciate the effort, it’s really ambitious. My take:

  1. FRC robots are highly customizable. the level of customization needed is too high to make it friendly enough for rookie members.
  2. The project feels too early; right now you can connect any block to any other with limited validation, which can confuse new students.
  3. As mentors, I believe that our goals is to teach real programming languages.

My recommandation is to narrow the scope of the project (for example, command-based generator) and add a strong validation.

Good luck!

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-07-31T13:20:52.807Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":183,"readers_count":182,"score":116.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":504836,"topic_slug":"frcodeblocks-blockly-to-java-for-frc","display_username":"Alon Vaisgur","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65231,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2231 Lead Software Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/frcodeblocks-blockly-to-java-for-frc/504836/8","custom_user_title":"2231 Lead Software Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5},{"id":"thinking","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3695332,"name":"Dan Peled","username":"Dan1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dan1/{size}/268085_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-31T14:38:06.811Z","cooked":"

Another note that I have is input variables in general for this, I cant input a variable by a single block into stuff, such as doing get encoder (encoder var) position, something like how Scratch handles these would a great thing imo

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-07-31T14:38:06.811Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":166,"readers_count":165,"score":43.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":504836,"topic_slug":"frcodeblocks-blockly-to-java-for-frc","display_username":"Dan Peled","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67107,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9738 Software Lead"},"post_url":"/t/frcodeblocks-blockly-to-java-for-frc/504836/9","custom_user_title":"9738 Software Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3695487,"name":"","username":"four","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/four/{size}/199902_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-31T18:45:10.196Z","cooked":"

I certainly do not want to discourage you from continuing with this project in any way but just want to ensure that you are aware that blocks support is also expected in 2027 WPILib. Having more resources is generally beneficial, but that is the likely state of the ecosystem.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-07-31T18:45:10.196Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":136,"readers_count":135,"score":62.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":504836,"topic_slug":"frcodeblocks-blockly-to-java-for-frc","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60512,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Doubling the current limit does not make it work."},"post_url":"/t/frcodeblocks-blockly-to-java-for-frc/504836/10","custom_user_title":"Doubling the current limit does not make it work.","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3697860,"name":"Brody Anderson","username":"flamekeeper","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/flamekeeper/{size}/267435_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-02T01:05:56.482Z","cooked":"

Thank you for the encouragement! I understand your concern on the ambitiousness of this project, but I believe it’s attainable due to the relatively straightforward structure of Wpilib, and how you can translate over almost every part of it into blocks. I plan on adding thorough errors and examples to help rookies understand why something that seems intuitive really just won’t be able to work. One of the biggest things, in my opinion, that helps people learn code is writing something that seems entirely correct, and learning why it isn’t.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-08-02T01:05:56.482Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":85,"readers_count":84,"score":22.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504836,"topic_slug":"frcodeblocks-blockly-to-java-for-frc","display_username":"Brody Anderson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":65231,"username":"AlonVaisgur","name":"Alon Vaisgur","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/alonvaisgur/{size}/220349_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74592,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/frcodeblocks-blockly-to-java-for-frc/504836/11","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3697869,"name":"Brody Anderson","username":"flamekeeper","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/flamekeeper/{size}/267435_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-02T01:07:54.588Z","cooked":"

I’m actually in the process of adding this now, it’s decently straightforward to copy down the WPILib docs into blocks since java is structured how it is

I did hear about this, I plan on keeping this up to date so teams can still use this as a learning materiel even if there’s a better standalone block code app, or so people can still do quick java mockups

Updates:

  • Added error handling
  • Added errors for invalid variable names
  • Added Xbox controller library
  • Added Joystick library

Coding students, leads, and mentors, I need your help:

One of the biggest current roadblocks is the size of WPILib, and I need to know what libraries need to have the highest priority. The API can be found here, please link, list, or open up an issue on github with what libraries YOU want to see first
